title: abandonment
description: The meaning of ABANDONMENT is the act of abandoning something or someone. How to use abandonment in a sentence.

definitions.title: a
definitions.description: relinquishment by an inventor of the right to enforce a patent

definitions.title: b
definitions.description: an author's relinquishment to the public domain of his or her copyrighted work

definitions.title: c
definitions.description: relinquishment of a trademark established by a failure to use the trademark and an intention never to resume use

definitions.title: d
definitions.description: the act of an insured in surrendering all rights to damaged or lost property to an insurer as a total loss

definitions.title: e
definitions.description: relinquishment by a trustee in bankruptcy of interest in property in the bankruptcy estate often for a nominal sum
the act of abandoning property or a right: as

definitions.title: a
definitions.description: failure to have contact with a spouse that is intended to create a permanent separation

definitions.title: b
definitions.description: failure to communicate with or provide financial support for one's child over a period of time that shows a purpose to forgo parental duties and rights
the act of abandoning a person: as
the act of abandoning a contract

definitions.title: a
definitions.description: the act of abandoning a course of action (as a crime)

definitions.title: b
definitions.description: the affirmative defense (as recognized under the Model Penal Code) of voluntary withdrawal from the commission of a crime resulting from the actor's change of heart and not from intervening circumstances

title: battery
description: the crime or tort of intentionally or recklessly causing offensive physical contact or bodily harm (as by striking or by administering a poison or drug) that is not consented to by the victim

definitions.title: aggravated battery
definitions.description: criminal battery that is accompanied by aggravating factors: as

definitions.title: a
definitions.description: criminal battery that causes or is intended to cause serious bodily injury especially through the use of a dangerous weapon

definitions.title: b
definitions.description: criminal battery committed on a protected person (as a minor or a police officer)
definitions.note:
Note:
            Aggravated battery is usually classified as a felony.

definitions.title: sexual battery
definitions.description: intentional and offensive sexual contact and especially sexual intercourse with a person who has not given or (as in the case of a child) is incapable of giving consent

definitions.title: simple battery
definitions.description: criminal battery that is not accompanied by aggravating factors (as a dangerous weapon)
